then spill out and stretch the meeting out on oh yes but if we do it in blue
then people who like red won't like it and bla bla bla bla bla bla bla so we
have a trick it's a protocol it's a pattern of behavior to overcome this and
it's called the decider and the way decider works is
as follows someone has to start the decision-making with a proposal and then
everybody votes and the votes is very simple it's Eva I agree with the
proposal it goes ahead I don't care so if it goes ahead doesn't matter to me I
disagree so someone makes a proposal I think we should make this in green if
everyone agrees or doesn't care it's in green that's it end of the conversation move forward if anyone has a thumbs down
there's a rule to putting your thumb down if you put your thumb down you have to come up with a counterproposal so if
you have your thumb down you have to say well I know people like green so my
proposal is that we make 75% of them green and 25% of them blue who's in and
then everyone votes again and it's a very fast way of getting decisions made
so it does kind of rely on the fact that people have had the conversation prior to
the data and there's so there's a side on this as well
which is that you mate someone makes a proposal you say who's in at the point

based on the new information it might be that the person originally made the proposal goes oh yeah I didn't think

think it's still valid and make them propose it again but it gives the person investigating and possibly everyone else
